question: Claire has a flower bed that is 150 meters long. Claire wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Claire's flowers grow 11 inches wide so she needs to leave 12.75 meters between every plant. Claire already owns 11 flowers. Each flowering plant costs £9 at the store, how much money will Claire spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Claire's flower bed is 150 meters / 12.75 meters per plant = <<150/12.75=11>>11 plants needed.
Claire needs to buy 11 plants - 11 plants = <<11-11=0>>0 plants needed to purchase.
Claire will spend 0 plants * £9 = £<<0*9=6>>6.
#### 6
